module_1.question: If \(y = 9\), what is the value of \(y + 15\)?
module_1.hint_english: Substitute \(y = 9\) and add \(15\).
module_1.hint_portugues: Substitua \(y = 9\) e some \(15\).

module_1.question:
Data set A: \(4, 6, 8, 12\)
Data set B: \(4, 6, 8, 12, 30\)

The lists give the values in data sets A and B. Which statement correctly compares the mean of data set A and the mean of data set B?

options.A: The mean of data set A is greater than the mean of data set B.
options.B: The mean of data set A is less than the mean of data set B.
options.C: The means of data set A and data set B are equal.
options.D: There is not enough information to compare the means.

module_1.hint_english: Compare the sums and the number of values in each data set.
module_1.hint_portugues: Compare as somas e o número de valores em cada conjunto.
solution_english: Therefore, Mean(A) < Mean(B), so option B is correct.
solution_portugues: Portanto, Média(A) < Média(B), então a opção B está correta.

module_1.question: Right triangles \(ABC\) and \(DEF\) are similar. Points \(A\) and \(D\) are the right angles. If the measure of angle \(B\) is \(25^\circ\), what is the measure of angle \(F\)?
module_1.hint_english: In a right triangle, angles sum to \(180^\circ\); use the fact that \(A\) and \(D\) are right angles and \(B\) corresponds to \(E\).
module_1.hint_portugues: Em um triângulo retângulo, os ângulos somam \(180^\circ\); use o fato de que \(A\) e \(D\) são ângulos retos e que \(B\) corresponde a \(E\).
solution_english: Angles in a triangle sum to \(180^\circ\). In \(ABC\), with \(A = 90^\circ\) and \(B = 25^\circ\), angle \(C = 180^\circ - 90^\circ - 25^\circ = 65^\circ\).
By similarity, angle \(F\) corresponds to \(C\), so \(F = 65^\circ\).
solution_portugues: Os ângulos de um triângulo somam \(180^\circ\). Em \(ABC\), com \(A = 90^\circ\) e \(B = 25^\circ\), o ângulo \(C = 180^\circ - 90^\circ - 25^\circ = 65^\circ\).
Pela semelhança, o ângulo \(F\) corresponde a \(C\), então \(F = 65^\circ\).

module_1.question: A tank contained \(\text{520,000}\) liters of water before draining. Exactly \(16\) seconds later, \(\text{392,000}\) liters of water remained. On average, approximately how many liters of water were drained each second?
module_1.hint_english: Find the total amount drained, then divide by the time in seconds.
module_1.hint_portugues: Encontre o total drenado e divida pelo tempo, em segundos.
solution_english: Correct average drained each second is \(\text{8,000}\) liters (option A).
solution_portugues: A média correta drenada por segundo é \(\text{8,000}\) litros (opção A).

module_1.question:
The solution to the given system of equations is \((x, y)\). What is the value of \(x + y\)?

\(\begin{cases}5x = 25 \\ -2x + y = 3\end{cases}\)
module_1.hint_english: Solve for x from the first equation, then substitute into the second.
module_1.hint_portugues: Resolva x a partir da primeira equação e substitua na segunda.
solution_english: Plug into \(-2x + y = 3\): \(-2(5) + y = 3 \Rightarrow -10 + y = 3 \Rightarrow y = 13\).
solution_portugues: Substituindo em \(-2x + y = 3\): \(-2(5) + y = 3 \Rightarrow -10 + y = 3 \Rightarrow y = 13\).

module_1.question: A student has enrolled in a total of \(96\) hours of training courses. The equation \(12x + 18y = 96\) represents this situation, where \(x\) is the number of in-person courses and \(y\) is the number of virtual courses. How many more hours does each virtual course take than each in-person course?
module_1.hint_english: Compare the coefficients: \(12\) hours for in-person vs. \(18\) hours for virtual.
module_1.hint_portugues: Compare os coeficientes: \(12\) horas presencial versus \(18\) horas virtual.
solution_english: From \(12x + 18y = 96\), each in-person course is \(12\) hours and each virtual course is \(18\) hours.
solution_portugues: Pela equação \(12x + 18y = 96\), cada curso presencial tem \(12\) horas e cada curso virtual tem \(18\) horas.

module_1.question: Square A has a side length of \(9\) centimeters. The perimeter of square B is \(3\) times the perimeter of square A. What is the length, in centimeters, of one side of square B?
module_1.hint_english: Perimeter scales linearly with side length.
module_1.hint_portugues: O perímetro escala linearmente com o comprimento do lado.

module_1.question: The function \(h(t) = -0.08t + 14.6\) models the number of gallons of fuel remaining in a truck after driving \(t\) miles. According to the model, approximately how many gallons of fuel are used per mile?
module_1.hint_english: The slope (coefficient of t) gives the change per mile.
module_1.hint_portugues: A inclinação (coeficiente de t) indica a variação por milha.
solution_english: The slope is \(-0.08\), meaning fuel decreases by \(0.08\) gallons per mile.
So \(0.08\) gallons are used per mile.
solution_portugues: A inclinação é \(-0.08\), indicando que o combustível diminui \(0.08\) galões por milha.
Logo, são usados \(0.08\) galões por milha.

module_1.question: If \(|6x - 10| = 74\), what is the positive value of \(x - 2\)?
module_1.hint_english: Solve the two absolute value cases, then subtract 2.
module_1.hint_portugues: Resolva os dois casos do valor absoluto e depois subtraia 2.

module_1.question: The equation relates the positive numbers \(p, x, y\): \(\tfrac{1}{5p} = \tfrac{9x}{y}\). Which equation correctly expresses \(x\) in terms of \(p\) and \(y\)?
module_1.hint_english: Cross-multiply to isolate x.
module_1.hint_portugues: Faça a multiplicação cruzada para isolar x.

module_1.question:
The table shows four values of \(x\) and their corresponding values of \(g(x)\):

\[\begin{array}{c|c} x & g(x) \\ \hline 5 & \text{41} \\ 10 & \text{66} \\ 15 & \text{91} \\ 20 & \text{116} \\ \end{array}\]

There is a linear relationship defined by \(g(x) = kx + 16\). What is the value of \(k\)?
module_1.hint_english: Use any point: slope \(k = (g(x) - 16)/x\).
module_1.hint_portugues: Use qualquer ponto: a inclinação é \(k = (g(x) - 16)/x\).
solution_portugues: Verificação com \(x = 10\) e \(g = 66\): \(66 = 10k + 16 \Rightarrow k = 5\). Valor consistente.

module_1.question: The expression \((7x^3 - 5) - (-2x^3 + 6)\) is equivalent to \(c x^3 - \text{11}\), where \(c\) is a constant. What is the value of \(c\)?
module_1.hint_english: Distribute the minus sign, then combine like terms.
module_1.hint_portugues: Distribua o sinal de menos e depois combine os termos semelhantes.

module_1.question: The point \((x, 27)\) is a solution to the system: \(y > 20\) and \(3x + y < 35\). Which of the following could be the value of \(x\)?
module_1.hint_english: Plug \(y = 27\) into \(3x + y < 35\) and solve for \(x\).
module_1.hint_portugues: Substitua \(y = 27\) em \(3x + y < 35\) e resolva para \(x\).

module_1.question: A population of insects was measured at an initial observation to be \(\text{120,000}\) insects. The population doubles every \(4\) hours. How many insects will there be \(12\) hours after the initial observation?
module_1.hint_english: 12 hours is three doubling periods (every 4 hours).
module_1.hint_portugues: 12 horas correspondem a três períodos de duplicação (a cada 4 horas).

module_1.question: The graph shows the estimated number of emails \(y\), in thousands, that a company sent to its customers at the end of each year, where \(x\) represents the number of years since the end of 2015, and \(0 \le x \le 8\). Which statement is the best interpretation of the \(y\)-intercept in this context?

options.A: The estimated total number of emails sent during the first 8 years was \(\text{12,000}\).
options.B: The estimated total number of emails sent from the end of 2015 to the end of 2023 was \(12\).
options.C: The estimated number of emails sent at the end of 2015 was \(12\).
options.D: The estimated number of emails sent at the end of 2015 was \(\text{12,000}\).

module_1.hint_english: y-intercept is the value of y when x = 0; values are in thousands.
module_1.hint_portugues: A ordenada na origem é o valor de y quando x = 0; valores em milhares.
solution_english: At \(x = 0\) (end of 2015), \(y\) is the starting value in thousands.
If the intercept is \(12\) (thousands), that is \(12{,}000\) emails at the end of 2015.
solution_portugues: Em \(x = 0\) (fim de 2015), \(y\) é o valor inicial em milhares.
Se a ordenada na origem é \(12\) (milhares), isso corresponde a \(12{,}000\) e-mails no fim de 2015.
A opção D corresponde a essa interpretação.

module_1.question: Which expression is equivalent to \((x^9 y^9)^{1/7}\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are positive?
module_1.hint_english: Rewrite the 7th root as power \(1/7\): \((x^9 y^9)^{1/7}\).
module_1.hint_portugues: Reescreva a raiz sétima como potência \(1/7\): \((x^9 y^9)^{1/7}\).

module_1.question: The population of City A increased by \(7\%\) from 2015 to 2016. If the 2016 population is \(k\) times the 2015 population, what is the value of \(k\)?
module_1.hint_english: An increase of 7% means multiply by \(1 + 0.07\).
module_1.hint_portugues: Um aumento de 7% significa multiplicar por \(1 + 0{,}07\).
solution_english: A 7% increase means the new amount is \(1 + 0.07 = 1.07\) times the old amount.
solution_portugues: Um aumento de 7% significa que o novo valor é \(1 + 0.07 = 1.07\) vezes o valor anterior.

module_1.question: Which of the following systems of linear equations has no solution?
module_1.hint_english: No solution when lines are parallel with different intercepts: same slope, different constant term.
module_1.hint_portugues: Não há solução quando as retas são paralelas e têm interceptos diferentes: mesma inclinação, termos constantes distintos.
solution_english: Option C has both equations with slope 16 but different y-intercepts (3 and 19), so the lines are parallel and never meet.
Thus, the system in option C has no solution.
solution_portugues: A opção C tem ambas as equações com inclinação 16, mas interceptos em y diferentes (3 e 19), portanto as retas são paralelas e nunca se encontram.
Assim, o sistema na opção C não tem solução.

module_1.question: The first term of a sequence is \(5\). Each term after the first is \(3\) times the preceding term. If \(a\) represents the \(n\)th term of the sequence, which equation gives \(a\) in terms of \(n\)?
module_1.hint_english: A geometric sequence with first term \(a_1 = 5\) and ratio \(r = 3\) has \(a_n = a_1\,r^{n-1}\).
module_1.hint_portugues: Uma PA geométrica com primeiro termo \(a_1 = 5\) e razão \(r = 3\) tem \(a_n = a_1\,r^{n-1}\).

module_1.question: The minimum value of \(x\) is \(8\) less than \(4\) times another number \(k\). Which inequality shows the possible values of \(x\)?
module_1.hint_english: If the minimum is \(4k - 8\), then \(x\) must be at least that value.
module_1.hint_portugues: Se o mínimo é \(4k - 8\), então \(x\) deve ser pelo menos esse valor.

module_1.question: In right triangle \(ABC\): \(AB = 24\), \(BC = 70\), \(AC = 74\). Triangle \(ABC\) is similar to triangle \(DEF\), where \(B\) corresponds to \(E\) and \(C\) corresponds to \(F\). What is the value of \(\tan F\)?
module_1.hint_english: Identify which sides are opposite/adjacent to angle \(F\) using similarity.
module_1.hint_portugues: Identifique quais lados são opostos/adjacentes ao ângulo \(F\) usando a semelhança.
solution_english: Given similarity: B ↔ E, C ↔ F, so angle F corresponds to angle C.
At C in triangle ABC, the opposite side is AB = 24, adjacent is BC = 70.
solution_portugues: Pela semelhança: B \u2194 E, C \u2194 F, logo o ângulo F corresponde ao ângulo C.
Em C no triângulo ABC, o lado oposto é AB = 24 e o adjacente é BC = 70.

module_1.question: The graph of \(6x + 4y = 12\) is translated up 3 units in the \(xy\)-plane. What is the \(x\)-coordinate of the \(x\)-intercept of the resulting graph?
module_1.hint_english: Translate up 3: replace \(y\) with \(y - 3\), then set \(y = 0\) to find the new x-intercept.
module_1.hint_portugues: Translade 3 unidades para cima: substitua \(y\) por \(y - 3\) e depois faça \(y = 0\) para achar o novo intercepto em x.
solution_english: For the new x-intercept, set \(y = 0\): \(6x = 24 \Rightarrow x = 4\).
solution_portugues: Para o novo intercepto em x, faça \(y = 0\): \(6x = 24 \Rightarrow x = 4\).

module_2_easy.question: If \(5x = 40\), what is the value of \(6x\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: First find \(x\), then multiply by 6.

module_2_easy.question: A farmer harvested 920 apples this year and saved 15% of them to sell at a local market. How many apples did the farmer save?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Compute 15% of 920.

module_2_easy.question: A machine produces labels at a constant rate of \(36\) labels per minute. At what rate, in labels per hour, does the machine produce labels?
module_2_easy.hint_english: There are 60 minutes in an hour.
solution_portugues: Produção média: \(36\) etiquetas/minuto × \(60\) minutos/hora = \(36 \times 60 = 2160\) etiquetas por hora.

module_2_easy.question: A line passes through the points \((2, 5)\) and \((8, 17)\). What is the slope of the line?
The x-intercept of the graph shown is \((x, 0)\). What is the value of \(x\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: The vertex touches the x-axis at the intercept.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: O vértice toca o eixo x no intercepto.
solution_english: From the graph, the parabola meets the x-axis at \(x = 7\).
solution_portugues: Pelo gráfico, a parábola cruza o eixo x em \(x = 7\).
Portanto, o intercepto em x é \((7, 0)\).

module_2_easy.question: The function \(f\) is defined by \(f(x) = 7x + 2\). What is the value of \(f(x)\) when \(x = 4\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Substitute \(x = 4\) into the expression.

module_2_easy.question: Each side of a square has length 45. What is the perimeter of this square?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Perimeter of a square is 4 times the side length.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: O perímetro de um quadrado é 4 vezes o comprimento do lado.

module_2_easy.question: The point with coordinates \((d, 4)\) lies on the line shown. What is the value of \(d\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Use the line passing through \((0,7)\) and \((8,0)\): find x when y = 4.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: Use a reta que passa por \((0,7)\) e \((8,0)\); encontre \(x\) quando \(y = 4\).
solution_portugues: A inclinação de \((0,7)\) a \((8,0)\) é \(-\tfrac{7}{8}\). Equação: \(y = -\tfrac{7}{8}x + 7\).

module_2_easy.question: Which expression is equivalent to \(6x^2 - 18xy^2\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Factor out the greatest common factor.

module_2_easy.question: The function \(g\) is defined by \(g(x) = 4x^2\). What is the value of \(g(6)\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Substitute \(x=6\) and compute.

module_2_easy.question: Each face of a fair 10-sided die is labeled with a different integer from \(1\) through \(10\). If the die is rolled one time, what is the probability of rolling a multiple of \(5\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Count multiples of 5 between 1 and 10.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: Conte os múltiplos de 5 entre 1 e 10.
solution_english: Multiples of \(5\) in \(1\ldots 10\) are \(5\) and \(10\) (2 outcomes).
solution_portugues: Os múltiplos de \(5\) em \(1\ldots 10\) são \(5\) e \(10\) (2 resultados).

module_2_easy.question: A line has slope \(-3\) and passes through the point \((2,7)\). Which equation represents this line?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Use point-slope form: \(y - 7 = -3(x - 2)\).

module_2_easy.question: A scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, \(x\) and \(y\). A line of best fit is also shown. Which of the following equations best represents the line of best fit?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Pick the equation with positive slope (~1.5) and intercept around 3.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: Escolha a equação com inclinação positiva (~1{,}5) e intercepto em y perto de 3.
solution_english: Line of best fit has positive slope and y-intercept near \(3.1\).
solution_portugues: A reta de melhor ajuste tem inclinação positiva e intercepto em y perto de \(3{,}1\).

module_2_easy.question: The dot plot represents the values in data set C. Data set D is created by adding \(40\) to each value in data set C. Which of the following correctly compares the medians and the ranges of data sets C and D?

options.A: The median of D is equal to the median of C, and the range of D is equal to the range of C.
options.B: The median of D is equal to the median of C, and the range of D is greater than the range of C.
options.C: The median of D is greater than the median of C, and the range of D is equal to the range of C.
options.D: The median of D is greater than the median of C, and the range of D is greater than the range of C.

module_2_easy.hint_english: Adding a constant shifts all values equally: median shifts by 40, range unchanged.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: Adicionar uma constante desloca todos os valores igualmente: a mediana sobe 40 e a amplitude não muda.
solution_english: Adding \(40\) increases median by \(40\) (so D's median is greater).
Range stays the same because spread is unchanged.
solution_portugues: Adicionar \(40\) aumenta a mediana em \(40\) (logo a mediana de D é maior).
O intervalo permanece o mesmo porque a amplitude não muda.

module_2_easy.question: Last month, a tutor earned \(\$1{,}020\) from teaching for \(x\) hours and grading assignments for \(y\) hours. The equation \(45x + 30y = 1{,}020\) represents this situation. Which of the following is the best interpretation of \(45\) in this context?

options.A: The tutor earned \(\$45\) per hour teaching.
options.C: The tutor earned \(\$45\) per hour grading assignments.
options.D: The tutor worked \(45\) hours grading assignments.

module_2_easy.hint_english: Coefficient of x is the rate for teaching hours.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: O coeficiente de \(x\) representa a taxa para as horas de ensino.
solution_english: The coefficient \(45\) multiplies teaching hours \(x\), so it represents \(\$45\) per hour for teaching.
solution_portugues: O coeficiente \(45\) multiplica as horas de ensino \(x\), portanto representa a remuneração de \$45 por hora de aula.

module_2_easy.question: The graphs of the equations intersect at the point \((x, y)\) in the \(xy\)-plane. Given \(x = 6\) and \(y = x^2 + 4\), what is the value of \(y\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Substitute x=6 into y = x^2 + 4.

module_2_easy.question: The graph of \(y = f(x)\) is shown. What is the value of \(f(0)\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Read the y-value at x = 0 on the graph.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: Leia no gráfico o valor de \(y\) quando \(x = 0\).

module_2_easy.question: Line \(k\) in the \(xy\)-plane has a slope of \(\tfrac{2}{5}\) and passes through the point \((10, 4)\). Which equation defines line \(k\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Use point-slope form with slope 2/5 and point (10,4).
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: Use a forma ponto-inclinação com inclinação \(	frac{2}{5}\) e ponto \((10,4)\).

module_2_easy.question: The function \(g\) is defined by \(g(x) = 6\sqrt{x}\). For what value of \(x\) does \(g(x) = 30\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Solve 6\sqrt{x} = 30.

module_2_easy.question: A museum sells tickets for \(\$25\) per adult and \(\$15\) per child. A group of \(18\) people attended, and the total cost was \(\$350\). How many people in the group were children?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Set up system: a + c = 18, 25a + 15c = 350.

module_2_easy.question: How many distinct real solutions does the equation \(3x^2 - 12x + 12 = 0\) have?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Check the discriminant: b^2 - 4ac.

module_2_easy.question: The equation \((x - 3)^2 + (y + 1)^2 = 25\) represents circle \(C\). Circle \(D\) is obtained by shifting circle \(C\) up \(5\) units in the \(xy\)-plane. Which of the following equations represents circle \(D\)?
module_2_easy.hint_english: Shifting up by 5 increases the y-coordinate of the center by 5.
module_2_easy.hint_portugues: Transladar 5 unidades para cima aumenta em 5 a coordenada y do centro.
solution_english: Shift up \(5\): new center is \((3, 4)\). Equation: \((x - 3)^2 + (y - 4)^2 = 25\), which is option B.
solution_portugues: Transladar 5 para cima: novo centro \((3, 4)\). Equação: \((x - 3)^2 + (y - 4)^2 = 25\), opção B.

module_2_hard.question: There are \(80\) students in the debate club. A random sample was surveyed, and \(25\%\) said they plan to attend a regional competition. Based on this survey, which of the following is the best estimate of the total number of debate club members who plan to attend the competition?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Compute 25% of 80.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Calcule 25% de 80.
solution_english: So about \(20\) students plan to attend.
solution_portugues: Então cerca de \(20\) alunos pretendem participar.

module_2_hard.question: A workshop produces metal parts and plastic parts, one at a time, for a total of \(600\) minutes each day. It takes \(12\) minutes to produce one metal part and \(6\) minutes to produce one plastic part. Which equation represents the possible number of metal parts, \(x\), and plastic parts, \(y\), the workshop can produce each day?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Total time = time per metal part \(\times x\) plus time per plastic part \(\times y\).
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Tempo total = tempo por peça de metal \(\times x\) mais tempo por peça plástica \(\times y\).
solution_english: Time for metals: \(12x\) minutes. Time for plastics: \(6y\) minutes.
solution_portugues: Tempo para metais: \(12x\) minutos. Tempo para plásticos: \(6y\) minutos.

module_2_hard.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, \(x\) and \(y\). A line of best fit is also shown. Which equation best represents the line of best fit?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Use the y-intercept near 13.5 and note the negative slope.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Use o intercepto em torno de 13,5 e note que a inclinação é negativa.
solution_english: Line crosses near \(y \approx 13.5\) when \(x = 0\) and slopes downward.
Negative slope about \(-0.8\); so \(y = 13.5 - 0.8x\). Option B.
solution_portugues: A reta cruza próximo de \(y \approx 13{,}5\) quando \(x = 0\) e desce.
Inclinação negativa próxima de \(-0.8\); portanto \(y = 13.5 - 0.8x\). Opção B.

module_2_hard.question: In the \(xy\)-plane, the graph of the equation \(y = 5^x\) is translated \(3\) units down. What is an equation of the resulting graph?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Vertical shifts add or subtract outside the function.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Translações verticais somam ou subtraem fora da função.
solution_english: Shifting down 3 subtracts 3 from the output: \(y = 5^x - 3\).
solution_portugues: Transladar 3 para baixo subtrai 3 da saída: \(y = 5^x - 3\).

module_2_hard.question: The point with coordinates \((d, 4)\) lies on the line shown. What is the value of \(d\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Find the line equation through (0,7) and (8,0), then set y = 4.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Encontre a equação da reta que passa por \((0,7)\) e \((8,0)\); depois faça \(y = 4\).

module_2_hard.question: For the quadratic function \(g\), three values are given: \(g(-1) = 12\), \(g(0) = 15\), \(g(1) = 20\). Which equation defines \(g\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Plug the given x-values; only one option fits all three.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Teste os valores de \(x\) dados; apenas uma opção funciona nos três casos.
solution_english: Check \(x = 1\): only A, B, D give \(20\); C gives \(21\).
Check \(x = -1\): A gives \(14\), B gives \(16\), C gives \(19\), D gives \(12\).
solution_portugues: Para \(x = 1\): apenas A, B e D dão \(20\); C dá \(21\).

module_2_hard.question: The function \(h\) is defined by \(h(x) = \tfrac{x + 20}{4}\), and \(h(a) = 9\), where \(a\) is a constant. What is the value of \(a\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Solve (a + 20)/4 = 9 for a.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Resolva \(	frac{a + 20}{4} = 9\) para \(a\).

module_2_hard.question: Line \(q\) is defined by \(4y - 12x = 8\). Line \(s\) is perpendicular to line \(q\) in the \(xy\)-plane. What is the slope of line \(s\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Find the slope of q, then use the negative reciprocal.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Ache a inclinação de \(q\) e use o recíproco negativo para a reta perpendicular.
solution_english: Rewriting: \(4y = 12x + 8 \Rightarrow y = 3x + 2\), so slope of \(q\) is \(3\).
solution_portugues: Reescrevendo: \(4y = 12x + 8 \Rightarrow y = 3x + 2\), então a inclinação de \(q\) é \(3\).
Uma reta perpendicular tem inclinação \(-\tfrac{1}{3}\) (opção B).

module_2_hard.question: A solid metal block has a density of \(2.7\) grams per cubic centimeter. The block is shaped like a cube with each edge measuring \(4\) centimeters. To the nearest whole number, what is the mass of the block, in grams?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Mass = density × volume. Volume of a cube is side^3.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Massa = densidade × volume. Volume de um cubo é lado³.
solution_english: Mass = \(2.7 \times 64 = 172.8\) grams; nearest whole number: \(173\) (option A).
solution_portugues: Massa = \(2{,}7 \times 64 = 172{,}8\) gramas; inteiro mais próximo: \(173\) (opção A).

module_2_hard.question: The function \(P(t) = 150(1.06)^{t/2}\) models a population (in thousands), where \(t\) is years. The population increases by \(n\%\) every \(2\) years. What is \(n\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Every 2 years corresponds to multiplying by 1.06 once.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: A cada 2 anos multiplica-se por \(1{,}06\) uma vez.
solution_english: The factor per \(2\) years is \(1.06\) → increase of \(6\%\).
solution_portugues: O fator a cada 2 anos é \(1{,}06\), ou seja, aumento de \(6\%\).

module_2_hard.question: In the equation \(3(mx - 4) = 6x - 10\), \(m\) is a constant. The equation has no solution. What is the value of \(m\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: For no solution, lines must be parallel with different intercepts (same slope, different constant term).
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Sem solução: retas paralelas com interceptos diferentes (mesma inclinação, termo constante distinto).
solution_english: Rewrite: \(3mx - 12 = 6x - 10\) ⇒ slopes: \(3m\) on LHS vs. \(6\) on RHS. For parallel lines, set \(3m = 6\) ⇒ \(m = 2\).
Then intercepts: LHS \(-12\), RHS \(-10\) are different, so the system has no solution.
solution_portugues: Reescreva: \(3mx - 12 = 6x - 10\); as inclinações são \(3m\) e \(6\). Para paralelas, \(3m = 6\) \Rightarrow \(m = 2\).
Os interceptos são \(-12\) e \(-10\), diferentes, então o sistema não tem solução.

module_2_hard.question: A store buys jackets at a wholesale price of \$40 each. The jackets are sold at a retail price that is \(250\%\) of the wholesale price. At season end, the jackets are discounted by \(60\%\) off the retail price. What is the final sale price of each jacket, in dollars?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Retail = 2.5× wholesale; then apply 60% off (keep 40%).
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Preço de varejo = 2{,}5× o atacado; depois aplique desconto de 60% (paga-se 40%).

module_2_hard.question: Data set A: \(40\) students, mean \(78\). Data set B: \(60\) students, mean \(85\). Data set C combines all students from A and B. What is the mean of data set C?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Use weighted mean: (n1*mean1 + n2*mean2)/(n1+n2).
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Use a média ponderada: \((n_1\cdot	ext{média}_1 + n_2\cdot	ext{média}_2)/(n_1 + n_2)\).

module_2_hard.question: The expression \(6x^2 + bx - 20\) can be written as \((mx + p)(x + q)\), with \(m\), \(p\), \(q\) integers. Which of the following must be an integer?
module_2_hard.hint_english: m must divide 6; constant term is p*q = -20; check which ratio always integer.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: \(m\) deve dividir 6; \(p q = -20\). Verifique qual razão é sempre inteira.
solution_english: We have \(m\,q = 6 \Rightarrow m\) divides \(6\), \(q = \tfrac{6}{m}\) (integer). Also \(p\,q = -20 \Rightarrow p = -\tfrac{20}{q}\) (integer). Thus \(q\) is integer ⇒ \(\tfrac{20}{p} = -q\) is always integer (option D).
solution_portugues: Temos \(m q = 6\) \Rightarrow \(m\) divide 6 e \(q = \tfrac{6}{m}\) é inteiro. Também \(p q = -20\) \Rightarrow \(p = -\tfrac{20}{q}\) é inteiro.
Logo \(q\) é inteiro, então \(\tfrac{20}{p} = -q\) é sempre inteiro (opção D).

module_2_hard.question: Consider the system: \(y = 3\) and \(y = x^2 - 4x + a\). If the system has exactly one distinct real solution, what is the value of \(a\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Set 3 = x^2 − 4x + a and require discriminant = 0.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Defina \(3 = x^2 - 4x + a\) e imponha discriminante igual a 0.

module_2_hard.question: In \(x^2 - 28x + c = 0\), there are no real solutions if \(c > n\). What is the least possible value of \(n\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: No real solutions when the discriminant is negative.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Não há raízes reais quando o discriminante é negativo.

module_2_hard.question: Data set A consists of \(40\) students with mean \(68\); data set B consists of \(60\) students with mean \(82\). Data set C combines all \(100\) students. What is the mean of data set C?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Weighted mean: (n1*mean1 + n2*mean2)/(n1+n2).
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Média ponderada: \((n_1\cdot	ext{média}_1 + n_2\cdot	ext{média}_2)/(n_1 + n_2)\).

module_2_hard.question: Suppose \(f(x) = \tfrac{a}{x + b}\) has a vertical asymptote at \(x = -6\). If \(g(x) = f(x - 3)\), which equation could define \(g(x)\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Find b from the asymptote, then shift input by −3.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Encontre \(b\) pela assíntota e depois desloque a entrada em \(-3\).

module_2_hard.question: In the quadratic equation \(42x^2 + (42b + a)x + ab = 0\), the product of the solutions is \(k\,ab\), where \(k\) is a constant. What is \(k\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: For ax^2 + bx + c = 0, product = c/a.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Para \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\), o produto das raízes é \(	frac{c}{a}\).

module_2_hard.question: The graph of \(x^2 + 4x + y^2 - 6y = 52\) is a circle. What is its radius?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Complete the square for x and y terms to find (x−h)^2 + (y−k)^2 = r^2.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Complete quadrados em \(x\) e \(y\) para obter \((x-h)^2 + (y-k)^2 = r^2\).

module_2_hard.question: Two identical square-based prisms have height \(60\,\text{cm}\) and surface area \(K\) each. Gluing them along one square base yields a prism with surface area \(\tfrac{49}{25}K\). What is the side length of the square base (cm)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Surface area of one prism: 2s^2 + 4s·60. Gluing removes two square bases (2s^2).
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Área de uma pirâmide: \(2s^2 + 4s\cdot60\). Ao colar, subtraem-se duas bases quadradas (\(2s^2\)).
solution_english: Two prisms: \(4s^2 + 480s\). Gluing removes \(2s^2\): glued SA = \(2s^2 + 480s\).
solution_portugues: Duas pirâmides: \(4s^2 + 480s\). Ao colar, removem-se \(2s^2\): área colada = \(2s^2 + 480s\).

module_2_hard.question: A parabola has vertex \((4, -9)\) and crosses the x-axis at two points. In \(y = ax^2 + bx + c\), which could be the value of \(a + b + c\)?
module_2_hard.hint_english: Use vertex form y = a(x−4)^2 − 9; require two real roots (a>0). Then evaluate a+b+c.
module_2_hard.hint_portugues: Use a forma de vértice \(y = a(x-4)^2 - 9\); exija duas raízes reais (\(a > 0\)) e então avalie \(a + b + c\).
solution_english: Take \(a = \tfrac{4}{9}\) ⇒ \(a + b + c = 9\left(\tfrac{4}{9}\right) - 9 = 4 - 9 = -5\) (option D), and the parabola still crosses the x-axis.
solution_portugues: Escolhendo \(a = \tfrac{4}{9}\): \(a + b + c = 9\left(\tfrac{4}{9}\right) - 9 = 4 - 9 = -5\) (opção D), e a parábola cruza o eixo x.
